page.title: 07A Queen's Counsel
page.content: Mr. Anthony Purnell, who lives in Ridgeway is a{Queen's Counsel}and must have been very excited when on the Thursday before Easter 1984 he received his letter of appointment. There are only about 400 Q.C's in the country. Mr. Purnell has{letters {patent}(a sort of licence): one an enormous document with a red seal appointing him Q.C.; the other signed by the Queen{(Elizabeth II R)}showing he is a{Recorder}- a kind of part-time judge - on at least 20 days a year. When Mr. Purnell is a judge, people in court call him "Your Honour". Mr. Purnell must dress properly in court, with a small grey wig, a white winged collar, a black waistcoat, a black frock coat and a black gown. While wearing these clothes, he visited an infants' class and one child shouted, "It's God!"
